implemented_features: Structured Data (Organization, WebSite, LocalBusiness, FAQ, Breadcrumbs, Article)
Schema markup for all major pages
next_steps_for_ranking: 1. Build high-quality backlinks from authoritative sites (e.g., government sites, food assistance blogs, local news)
2. Create fresh, unique content regularly (city guides, SNAP policy updates, store reviews)
3. Encourage user-generated content (reviews, comments, store contributions)
4. Build domain authority over time (typically 6-12 months minimum)
5. Focus on long-tail keywords with lower competition initially
6. Get listed in relevant directories (SNAP resources, food assistance sites)
7. Build social media presence and engagement
8. Monitor Google Search Console for indexing issues and opportunities
9. Create location-specific content for high-value cities
10. Establish E-A-T (Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness) through quality content and citations

realistic_timeline.3_months: Indexed and ranking for long-tail, low-competition keywords
realistic_timeline.6_months: Top 10 for some medium-competition keywords with backlinks
realistic_timeline.12_months: Potential for top 5 rankings with consistent effort and quality backlinks
realistic_timeline.18_24_months: Competitive for #1 positions in specific niches with strong authority

important_notes: Ranking #1 is not guaranteed by technical SEO alone
Competition level varies significantly by keyword
Backlinks are the most important external ranking factor
User engagement metrics (CTR, time on site, bounce rate) matter significantly
Local SEO requires different strategies than national SEO
Regular content updates signal freshness to search engines
